Reviews.Title: “Good choice for your hospital stop-over”
Reviews.Author: Nogbad69
Reviews.Content: Whilst not located in the nicest quarter of Miami this hotel offers excellent access to the Jackson Memorial Hospital with a 1/2 hourly shuttle service to all the main departments. With a car it takes only minutes to head downtown and over to Miami Beach and the rail-system station is just around the corner. Can´t really fault the hotel itself, its what you would expect from a Marriott chain hotel and the staff were friendly, professional and helpful. Over the weekend we opted to eat breakfast out although it was included in the from price because it was a little basic! Didn´t see a business centre but there is free Wifi throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Bellsmay
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that had a shuttle service from the airport and to the port, and also offered breakfast.. Here it is. I travelled with my husband and daughter. When we arrived at the airport we waited for about an hour for the shuttle bus.We phoned the hotel and they told us that you need to let them know that you're ready, and then you'll get picked up. This hadn't been made clear before hand! And after a 10 hour flight with a 18 month old baby, we were slightly annoyed. However, when we got to the room, things changed for the better. All the extras we had requested were already in place (travel cot etc). And we were offered a complimentary meal from the hotel due to our 90mins wait at the airport. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. We had requested a place on the 10am shuttle bus to the port. I believe there were several other time slots available, offhand I cannot remember what they were. Breakfast was great. Local police and doctors from the medical centre ate breakfast there also. The buffet breakfast options were refilled regularly. There was a choice of cereals, breads, muffins and fruit. Along with 'hot' breakfast options such as bacon, eggs, waffles (make your own) etc. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MIXED FEELINGS”
Reviews.Author: clauotero
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok ... The staff was very helpful and when we had our complaints they delivered. The rooms were clean, which is a huge plus. The beds were comfortable, however the sofa bed was TERRIBLE. It literally had the springs poking out, it was unbearable to sleep there. We had to purchase an inflatable matress so we could all fit. The breakfast was good, internet connection was good. The things I did not like: THE NEIGHBORHOOD !!!! Oh my was it terrible terrible terrible. Across the street there was a house with chickens and hens in the front yard. Too many homeless people around. There was no easy access to many things, such as an ATM, a fast food restaurant, etc .... everything driving distance. The guests were basically people that were going to go to the hospital or their relatives. Also, since the court is around the corner people who are in trials and whaat not.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STOP BEFORE A CRUISE”
Reviews.Author: JETGroveland
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here the night prior to departing on a cruise. We chose it because it was affiliated with Marriott, which we like. Unfortunately, the shuttle from the airport to the hotel runs only once an hour, and we just missed it, when we landed. We arrived at the hotel early enough that the rooms were not ready, but they gave us the handicap room, so we were able to grab a bite in the restaurant, then go right to bed. Our room was huge, and very well equipped and comfortable for anybody. The bathroom had plenty of counter space, which some handicapped baths do not. The room had a sitting area, desk area, two queen size beds, and two bathroom areas, one with potty and a sink, with plenty of counter space, and one with shower and a sink, with plenty of counter space. The restaurant, which is in the lobby, has a full bar, and a selection of sandwiches, hors d'oeuvres, and other light fare, which were excellent. A hot breakfast is included in the room price. The local neighborhood did not appear attractive, so we did not walk around. We saw no stores or shopping areas in the area. The hotel ran a shuttle (nominal fee) directly to our ship. The hotel was very comfortable, self contained, convenient, with transportation to both airport and cruise terminal. I would definitely stay here again as a restful stopover between flights and cruises.

Reviews.Title: “Well run property, quality experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to visit this property with a business colleague last month. We had business with several hospitals/clinics at the University of Miami Medical center complex. This property was very convenient to the medical complex, being approx. 1 to 3 blocks away depending upon where in the complex you are going. Rooms were clean, modern and well appointed. A free, quality hot breakfast was served. There is only one restaurant within walking distance other than the Au Bon Pain facility in the medical complex. If you don't have a car this might cause some difficulty. The property has onsite under cover parking that appears to be relatively secure but it is very tight with respect to actually navigating the parking ramp structure. Staff and hotel management was attentive and helpful. My only negative comment, and I shared this with the management who agreed, was that since this was a property adjoining a major medical center and had patients/family staying, should have hand sanitizers at the entrance/exit doors and elevators. Over all this was a good experience and a good value. I will be staying here when I visit the medical complex again. Neighborhood is a "little dicey" and I would not recommend evening strolls.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: tbrider28
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here before leaving from Port of Miami on a cruise. My husband and I shared a room with my sister and a friend. The room was great, very open with a nice sitting area, fridge, desk, etc. The toilet was in a small space with a tiny corner sink, with a frosted glass sliding door....not ideal for sharing a room. A large closet was between the toilet and the rest of the washroom, the sink and a large shower. The room was new and fresh. The restaurant was great, the canteen helpful, internet access and free wireless within the hotel. No complaints, except when we landed at Miami we said the Springhill Suits airport/by the university and we were brought to a different Springhill Suites. Make sure you ask for the medical centre hotel! Staff was very busy but helpful. Decent breakfast the next day, make yourself waffles, fruit, yogurt, eggs, etc. Would stay again except we would like to be closer to Bayside and in a safer neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, convenient for hospital, but my bluetooth was stolen”
Reviews.Author: rayl33
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is not in a great area but it is convenient if you have business at Jackson Memorial and that seems to be why most of the guests stay there. I could not find the jacuzzi that was reported in my guest brochure, but the room was fine (although I wasn't a big fan of the decor) and the breakfast was fine. The bathroom is split into a toilet area and a shower area and the sliding door on the shower area does not close completely, which as a bit annoying. I also do not understand why they don't have pay per view movies. I ordered a southwestern salad from their restaurant (there's no decent restaurants nearby) which was decent. The complimentary shuttle to and from the airport and the hospital is a nice perk, although I had to wait 90 minutes at the airport for the shuttle when I arrived. In any case, my main complaint is that I checked out very early because I had an early interviewed. I stashed my luggage downstairs with the receptionist. Ten minutes after leaving, I realized that I had left my phone charger and blue tooth in my room. I knew exactly where they were so I called reception, asked them to retrieve them, and told them their exact locations. Unfortunately, when I returned that afternoon to get my luggage, my charger, and my bluetooth, only my charger was returned to me. The receptionist claimed that no bluetooth was found. This was very, very disappointing (and costly) as I had definitely left my tooth on the bedside table as I had told them.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: endeeye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at SpringHill Suites by Marriott Miami Airport East/Medical Center for 1 night before my visit to Jackson Memorial. The hotel is a couple blocks to the hospital so it was great location to stay. The complimentary airport shuttle was prompt and they also service to the hospital and Bayside Marketplace (for dining and entertainment since there aren't really any nearby restaurants to walk to). You will have sign up at front desk. The bedrooms are clean and pretty spacious. Staff was friendly and complimentary breakfast was satisfying. This hotel is not only great for hospital visits but also good for pre or post cruise stays since it is a few minutes from the port (next to Bayside). Other than that, don't expect any frills. The swimming pool is small. The gym is nice however, and the secured parking lot is convenient since the hotel is in a neighborhood setting. The one thing I will do during my next visit is request for a room away from the highway, since it was a little noisy while trying to rest at night. Other than that, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, not so nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Betwit
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, so I never did see this hotel during the daytime, but at night it looked like a fortress in a bad neighborhood. We had to drive around twice to find the entrance. When we got inside, the staff was very welcoming. We had a King room with a sofa which was nicely laid out, and decor was cool IKEA-like with some nice features, like a partition between the "office" and the bed space, and a large screen TV that swiveled between the spaces. Shuttle service was prompt.

Reviews.Title: “strange floor plan, not suite, room feels dirty”
Reviews.Author: Siu2001
Reviews.Content: First of all, approaching the hotel already made us quite uneasy - the location, the neighborhood, the entrance, the lobby - everything is below our expectation of a Marriott / SpringHill property. Then the room - it is not a suite at all, just a rectangular space, no hall way, no kitchen counter, nothing to even half separate the space, just sofa towards the door, next to a bed and another bed and then the window. Standing at the door you see them all. More strangely is the layout of the bathroom - a sliding door facing one bed leads to a bathroom with standing shower only, ANOTHER sliding door facing the other bed lead to the toilet room, in between is the closet, So you have to come out from the toilet, pass the 2 beds, to enter the bathroom. This leave the TV stand at an awful position of the room. The closet is not painted but has lots of scratches and dirty marks all over the wall. The light green carpet and sofa is full of stains. You won't believe it is a ~2-yr old property. The staff is nice, breakfast is typical but OK, the small court yard is well maintained. An average hotel I'd say, but a very poor SpringHill/Marriott one.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel - Weak Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Ocdman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night precruise. We had a 6 pm arrival and were leaving on the cruise the next morning. We are a family of 4 and given our short stay I didn't want to rent 2 rooms. I picked this hotel because the room had 2 queen size beds and a sofa bed, free breakfast and free airport shuttle. The room was in fact large and the breakfast was what you would expect. The shuttle was disappointing; upon landing we called the hotel and was told the shuttle only runs on the hour that we had just missed it and there would not be another one until the next hour. I believe that if you advertise having a free airport shuttle you need to run it more frequently than once an hour. Rather than waiting I paid for a cab to the hotel. The hotel itself was clean but as many have mentioned it is located in a marginal neighborhood. Next morning we took a cab to the cruise ship. The hotel offered a shuttle but it was $5 per person so for my family of 4 it was the same price as taking a cab (plus there was no availablity on the shuttle until early afternoon). Overall the hotel was fine for one night precruise (or if I was in need of the hospital) but I would not stay there otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Miami tourist locations”
Reviews.Author: IcameIsaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a king-size bed suite. Check-in was quick and parking was convenient and secure. Our room was on the quiet side, away from the highway. The decor was very European and trendy. The hotel has a small outdoor pool which we enjoyed. Morning breakfast was good though they mostly repeated the menu. Even though the hotel is not in a touristy location we could easily cover all the locations easily in 15-20 minutes by car e.g. South Beach, Key Biscane, Bayside, Coral Gables, Little Havana. Even though the neighbourhood was a bit rundown, the property is new and clean. My brother stayed at the same hotel with his family in a two queen-size beds suite which was larger. My only gripe is that they couldn't get us side-by-side rooms, probably because we had different kind of suites.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware ... of location”
Reviews.Author: meetjimbo
Reviews.Content: I'm perplexed over the high reviews for this property given the rather sketchy location it's located in. Don't be alarmed when you pull up to the entrance to find a gate surrounding it, presumably to keep the transients from the local neighborhood, or shall I say, 'hood', out. Look, unless you need to be at the Medical Center, or have a real desire to stay at this property, I'd say go back to one of the airport properties that are in a much better, and safe, location. Although the hotel has been updated and the rooms are freshened up, it's still not worth the bad locale. Go stay at the Marriott at MIA airport, the Courtyard at MIA or any number of those surrounding properties. If you look hard enough, you'll find a deal comparable to what you would find here. I would be embarrassed if I had sent a client to this hotel before actually checking it out first for myself. If this hotel were in a better location, it would be garner a better review from me. I would not go back as there is nothing within walking distance...then again, you don't really want to be out walking in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Glenn/Barb Cruise”
Reviews.Author: badseven
Reviews.Content: The hotel room setting very moderning with a hint of European style. I love the romantic shower room.The seperate toilet room is like the U.K. decor. I enjoyed the Breakfast. Quick visite ,only used the Hotel to be near the Cruise port . Hotel location and view was not the best,but it looked safe. Staff were very polite and yes i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would return”
Reviews.Author: Nadia B
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my mom. The property is near the airport, and really near Bascom Palmer which is where we needed to go. They provide a complimentary shuttle from the airport, and to and from the medical center. Breakfast was included. The staff are indifferent, maid service left alot to be desired and breakfast is awful. There were two staff members who did not make me feel like I was an intrusion a gentleman at breakfast and the young lady who checked my bags as I arrived earlier in the day than 3pm. The room was comfortable, and had plenty of space so you did not feel cramped. The tv could be better placed. Microwave and fridge were good to have. We keep dnd on our door and need very little from maid service, but one request for towels was never honored and when we were ready for maid service, the wait was extensive. when our housekeeper finally showed up, she gave us fresh towels, sprayed and wiped the sink and toilet, straightened the bed and left. Oh - she swept the hair off the floor in the bathroom. The carpet was neither swept nor vacuumed and the sofa was not straightened. The glasses in the bathroom were not changed, and none of the hard/soft surfaces were wiped or dusted... she did wish me a nice day before she left the room. maybe she was afraid of me? :) The pool is really small, but we did not go for that. The gym is well equipped. Breakfast is cramped and I never got an offer of something other than what was offered. Selections are limited and the assortment needs to be repositioned so folks are not reaching over and beyond you for different things. Coffee was pretty bad and you get to use the posh plastic utensils, plates and cups... urghggghhhh. :( The price is middle of the road so we would return, but now we know not to expect to much from the staff, we will keep our expectations low.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to spend a night before or after your cruise”
Reviews.Author: tngl4ut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night recently before going on a cruise. Overall it is a good place to stay for a night. The positives are that the rooms were spacious. Wi-fi is free and worked very well in our room on the 5th floor. The hotel has self serve laundry machines that only cost $1.50 per wash and per dry. Their airport shuttle is free. They offer a cruise shuttle for $5 per person which is cheapest I saw. It dropped us right off at the cruise ship terminal. There weren't any glaring negatives but there are a few things to be aware of. The first thing is that the hotel is in a rough part of town and there are no restaurants within a short walk. There is a Win Dixie somewhat close by. The breakfast was free but wasn't of good quality. There were few options and it was difficult to find a seat. We had to sit at the bar. The staff was also struggling to keep the dining area clean as well. Decent place to spend a night but not a good choice to be close to sights or anything else for that manner.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay at Springhill in mid-November 2011”
Reviews.Author: WorldCaravan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for business. The hotel is conveniently located next to the University of Miami/Jackson Memorial Hospital campus. Of course, it's in a bad part of town, but you expect most major hospitals to be in these urban settings. Either way, I felt safe in the hotel as there were many travellers staying overnight to be taken by shuttle to the Port for cruises ($5 fee). There are also complementary shuttle services to the hospital and airport; however, you must reserve in advance as the seats fill up fast! I actually rented a car and parked in the gated parking garage with room key access for $13/night (in & out privileges included). My room was facing the highway, which was audible, but I'm used to sleeping in big cities and blocking out the noise. If you are sound sensitive or a light sleeper, I recommend bringing earplugs or trying to get a room on the other side of the hotel. Otherwise, the room was okay. I had two queen beds and a sofa. I checked the sheets of the first bed and noticed that there was a red-brown stain about 2 inches in diameter on the mattress cover that I could see through the fitted sheet. So, I chose to sleep in bed #2, which had no stains. The sheets smelled of Febreze and were clean. There were some stains on the green carpet, but this is expected as there is a high turnover of guests that bring food in their rooms and accidently spill their coffee, etc. The bathroom was clean (towels, sink), although the tub did have some trace black grime on the bottom were the grip pattern is located. You usually should wear your shower sandals/shoes in public baths anyway and you'll be fine. The shower head was fabulous--the water pressure was strong and had good hot water but you can choose to have a cold shower as Miami is hot and humid! (And don't worry--the air conditioner is good and can handle the humidity.) The toilet is clean and in a separate room from the shower, equipped with a small sink, too. If you are sensitive to smell, you can just catch a slight whiff of septic backup/sewage, but you don't smell this when you shut the door and go back to your bed. Breakfast was like any other continental buffet services--lots to choose from and certainly not gourmet but quick and easy for those of you on the go. What I liked best about this hotel was the 2 guest computers (+ a printer) that you can use for internet access (15 minute courtesy limit, but if no one is around, you can use it for longer--the page does refresh every 15 minutes though, for security purposes, and restarts Internet explorer). Unfortunately, the Internet explorer on these computers is version 6, which is not compatible with many sites. You can check your flight status, email or facebook account without any problem. I recommend you not use your credit card unless you have to as there is no menu function to erase cookies, files, etc. The internet program says "secure" because it claims to erase your information after each 15 minute session, but you can still see the website history in the address bar. This hotel is good for its location and for a one to two nights stay. If you need long term stationing because of the nearby hospital, it's good for that too as it appears that this hotel is one of the better in the area for that necessity. I must mention that even at the discounted rate of $109 + tax from the University of Miami, it is a little pricey for what you get. Essentially, you're paying for the convenience of location. Otherwise, if you're going to Miami beach, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Irieas
Reviews.Content: I had to work in Miami at a big firm in the buliding next to the Intercontinental at One Chopin Plaza. They were full and could not take me - and so my luck began... The hotel looks new and it is fresh and CLEAN. And the staff are so super - especially Leandra! My room was large and had a COMFY King bed and a neat sitting area from which you can actually watch the big TV with a nice couch and a very ample work desk with all the necessary connectors PLUS free wifi. The room also had a mini-bar area with microwave, coffee maker, and a little refrigerator. You can also easily watch tv in bed. The fact that the toilet has its own area with sliding door AND a little handbasin was a nice touch, and the shower area with huge counter and hand sink was spotless, and really nice. Shower has glass doors and a good showerhead which is adjustable. There is a 24 hour complimentary coffee/tea station with caf/decaf and hot water and black AND herbal teas. There are complmentary guest computers from which you may print without cost. There is a cool little pool in one area and in another, a sun lounge area for smokers outside. Breakfast is included and ALWAYS has eggs and a breakfast meat, hot oatmeal, four or five cereals and cold milk, 2 kinds of yogurt - Activia and Fit and Light, 3 kinds of bagel, plain, multigrain and cinnamon raisin, 2 kinds of little muffins, English Muffins, and other breads, apples, bananas and 2 kinds of waffle mix and waffle irons to make your own. plus apple/orange juice. The 1311 restaurant is not a big menu - but the WINGS are MAJORLY good, as is the Black Bean soup, the 1311 burger, the sweet potato fries and the spring rolls and several great salads. It also has a great in- house market with a frozen food section with personal Digiorno pizza, Lean cuisine, and Souffers entrees and ice cream, and another cooler full of beers, sodas, teas, juices and gatorade. It has Mac and Cheese and Chun noodles, and soup mixes as well as granola, trail mix and healthy snacks as well as junk! They also sell little packs of tums and other necessaries. Prices are reasonable. The neighborhood is not the best, but neither are you in a ghetto, and its SO NICE INSIDE, that you forget the outside world exsists... I will stay AGAIN and again, without any doubt...

Reviews.Title: “Staff has treated my aunt like fsmily she has been staying there for six months”
Reviews.Author: Jewels68_11
Reviews.Content: My uncle has been in jackson memorial hospital for six months and my aunt needs to be near him. Marriott ha become her home and I'm forever grateful for the wasy the staff has treated her since most of our family is in nyc. I was there last weekend for the second time and once again you guys are great

Reviews.Title: “If you stay in Miami, Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: houndnurse1970
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough nice things about this hotel. I do a lot of research on hotels before I decide on a place to stay. I had initially chosen another hotel for our pre/post cruise stay, but saw this one on tripadvisor and decided to make a last minute change. I am so glad I did! The hotel is so clean, and when I say clean, I mean clean. Upon entering hotel rooms, yes I am a freak, I look under mattresses/pictures for evidence of bed bugs, corners of showers for mold, and for cockroaches. All I found was a tiny bit of mold in the shower which is to be expected. The mattress was so comfortable, I think I slept better at this hotel than I do at my own home, I only wish I would have remembered what brand it was. The breakfast was complimentary and it was excellent. They had a variety of foods to choose from. The shuttle service was also a plus. We were picked up at the airport in a timely fashion after our flight. We also used it to go to the Port of Miami. The first night we stayed, I didn't realized we had to "reserve" the shuttle for our afternoon transport to the Port, so when we went to down to the main desk that morning, the shuttle service was fully booked. The lady at the desk had us wait for Luis (I think he was the manager of the shuttle service) and he so kindly fit us in and took us to the Port. He was very kind and treated us very nicely. He also gave us some good advice on the way to the Port in regards to safety on our cruise. We also relaxed outside by the pool. I didn't actually use the pool, so I don't know how the water was, but the only negative thing was that it was a little loud with emergency sirens/traffic and we even heard chickens outside by the pool. The water in the shower could have been warmer. I'm used to hotter water, but this is only a petty thing. I never seen any restaurants close to the hotel, but I didn't get out and walk the block either. Anyway, the is the best hotel I have ever stayed at and the price is reasonable for everything you get. Oh yeah, they also let us check in 1 1/2 hour early without any problems because I had made an error on our flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stays!”
Reviews.Author: JimF352
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on three different occasions to visit a relative in Jackson Memorial Hospital. They give a wonderful discount to visitors to the medical campus and to out-patients staying in the hotel. They provide free shuttle service to the Jackson medical campus and to the Port of Miami. The venue is new, spotlessly clean, and the rooms are spacious with microwave, fridge, and wide, flatscreen TV. One reviewer wrote that it is "run down" and the room smelled of smoke. Nonsense. He may be a competing hotelier trying to bash this fine hotel for his own gain, but whatever his motivation his comments are completely fictional. Another reviewer said it is in a bad area. We walked back and forth to the hospital every day and never had a single worry. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise. Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jerry P
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Springhill Suites East/Medical Center 2 days before our cruise. After reading alot of reviews about hotels in the downtown area, we decided on this one. Mainly for the price of $99 per night plus the rooms would accomodate 5 people each with no additional fees. There were no surprises. Many of the comments I read were right on, so i was not disappointed in the least. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The room are very spacious, new and clean with very comfortable beds. The pool is a bit small but was perfect size to refresh yourself or get some sun. The hotel is not located in a tourist area so there is not much to do in the neighborhood. University Sports Bar is located within walking distance for a quick sandwich or drinks. Even though the neighborhood looked a little run down I never felt unsafe and really never noticed the traffic noise. If you have a longer stay a car would be useful even though parking is a bit high at $13.00 a night. The free hot breakfast was great in the morning with many options. They do provide a free shuttle from Miami International Airport, just call the hotel when you arrive. They also provide shuttle service to Bayside Marketplace at scheduled times. This is a great place to spend a day shopping or to catch lunch or dinner. Shuttle service was also provided to the Port of Miami for a $5.00 charge per person. A cab may have been a bit cheaper, since your so close. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and I would not hestitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, Great for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: slotplayer424
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, modern and come with a fridge and microwave. We have stayed at this hotel 4 times so far. Great place to stay the night befor/ after a cruise. Your vehicle is in secure parking for $15/ day. Would reccomend to friends :-) Louis is a asset ( one of the drivers) Transportation to the port or hospital is a free servce provided at this hotel. Note: return service is NOT provided for the port.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Gracelyn G
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff was wonderful. They have their own restaurant and bar. The drinks were great. They have a continential breakfast beginning at 6am. The rooms are clean and spacious. There were three of us in the room. They are a little pricey, however its well worth it. I would stay at this hotel again when I go back to miami. Most of all, they have free internet service, and shuttle buses to and from the hospitals.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel Near Miami Hospitals but Pricey for Long Term stays”
Reviews.Author: SCRAPPYJupiter
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here several times when my brother was a patient at the University of Miami hospital. It is tucked away off several highway ramps and loud when you went outside due to traffic noise- but the rooms were nice and the service attitude was excellent. They know families are stressed when a loved one is ill and took good care of us at meals and times when we needed their help and advice. We felt like we got to know the staff and that means alot in the impersonal world. The restaurant is friendly and blends into the lobby and it came in very handy for tired meals after a long day of visiting hours. Truly a respite but pricey overall. Good shuttle services to the hospitals but make sure you check the schedule as there are gaps in service. Great Location but dangerous neighborhood overall so be careful. Expensive Parking too.

Reviews.Title: “I love the smell of cigarrettes in the morning”
Reviews.Author: GlobalCitizen86
Reviews.Content: Despite signs that say no smoking, my room wreaked like cigarrette. Everytime i came back after work, i swear it would be even more pungent, like the cleaning lady had been smoking in it while I was away. However, the staff was very nice and the room rate isn't bad for Miami, but you are in a bad part of town and the hotel is a little rundown and shows its age. I usually love the Springhill Suites, but this one was not up to par. I would have given it 2 1/2 stars if i could, because despite the cigarrettes, the staff really was great

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: veronak
Reviews.Content: For what we paid this was a great value, the staff was extremely nice. However, I would recommend breakfast at an off site location, it was like Grand Central Station. Other than that, great location, very close to downtown, shopping and beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: ambadkar
Reviews.Content: The rooms was large and comfortable. Was located a bit off tourist attractions, but then the place has been developed for people requiring medical services of Univ of Miami Medical Center. Downside, major co-guests were old and there for some kind of medical treatment. Result, the atmosphere in breakfast room was more sombre than cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Kerrinhp
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the large rooms and convenient shuttle service to Bayside and the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “Has pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: wykke
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night of May 18, 2011. Rooms were nice, clean and roomy. the staff closing a service door with a bang at all hours interrupted sleep.(need to cushion that service door).The separate price for parking your car, $13.00 per night is a bit much, is gated though.. The restaurant is out of the question. Way too High for what you get $ 2.95 for soft drinks, $5.95 for Black Bean soup that comes from a can and heated.. $9.95 to heat up a small frozen name brand Pizza. You do get discount if you are there for Hospital Purposes. They have a very small swimming/wading pool (guess would have it at 6 foot wide and 20 foot long and deep end is 5 feet. ( and no life guard). total stay excluding food and after taxes and parking $139.03

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yvargas925
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review as I enjoy my delicious warm breakfast & great WiFi in the dining room! It's a bit tricky to get to the hotel and you wonder if you'll be safe because of the bad location, but everything has gone smoothly and our car is in the covered garage, so no worries! Our room is beautiful! LOVE the contemporary and new feel! Very clean and modern! Our room has a great view of the city, but ask for a room on a high floor... Customer service has been very good too! There is a restaurant downstairs and we ordered lunch yesterday and picked it up to take to our room, good prices (delicious burger!!) All in all, I highly recommend our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't park on the street!”
Reviews.Author: amseater
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. Friendly staff, good food at the restaurant. I arrived around midnight and the front desk clerk encouraged me to park "for free" on the street, but failed to mention whatever the cutoff time is for "free" parking and when I went to get my car in the morning to leave for my appointment I had an $18 parking ticket! Bad advice!!!! Spend the $10 and park in the parking garage to avoid the ticket. The only thing nearby is the hospital, no where to walk to a restaurant, etc, so if you want to be in a neighborhood with entertainment other activities nearby this won't be the place you want to stay. That said, it was very nice, super clean and well staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems in the room, drug users in garage”
Reviews.Author: junglecat64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at many Springhill Suites (with 2 or 3 kids) and have generally been very satisified. Not this time. At $180 per night plus $15 for parking plus tax on all that, we had expected more from a hotel that is 1.5 years old. Our room was #319, and there were stains on the pullout sofa upholstery, the desk chair was all the way down with no way to adjust height and the toilet seat was loose and managed to pinch my scrotum. Ouch ! The internet cable? Not plugged in - no wonder it didn't work. It bothered me that when I told staff about the problems in the room, the were unsmiling and seemed defensive. Then there were the drug user in the garage, but why did I have to tell security about that? DonÃ¤t they have cameras? And as other travelers have pointed out, the neighborhood is not great. No offer of extra Marriott points or anything, not that this was the reason I told them about the problems. My advice: check the room before making a decision. At the rate we paid, some of that money should have been put into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a specific purpose”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityRealtor
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night stay at Springhill Suites. My mother had surgery at the University of Miami hospital, and this hotel has special UofM hopital rates which are lower than any other available rate we could find for this particular location. This is a new hotel (less than one year old), and although the surrounding area is not wonderful, or scenic, or even perhaps safe, the hotel made a stressful situation much easier to endure. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. The first night's stay was in a queen double room on the quiet side of the hotel with a skyline view. The subsequent five nights I switched to a king room which overlooked a busy highway which was some what noisy, with bright lights. The room was smaller than the double queen room, which had a huge walk in closet, but the work area in the king room was nicer. Both had the same bathroom layout - two separate rooms, one with vanity and large shower, the other with commode and small corner sink. The amenities were also better than expected. The hot breakfast buffet was adequate, there was a restaurant (slow service and limited menu) and a bar, a very good exercise room, small pool which needed cleaning. The desk staff were always pleasant and helpful. Be aware that parking is at an additional fee, which wasn't surprising as I live in Chicago. They have a market for a quick snack, which I wish had more choices as there are very few choices in the area for dining, and late hospital hours requires more choices. They do have a complimentary shuttle service to the hospital, as well as the dock for cruises. I will say that the array of guests made people watching very entertaining! I would highly recommend staying at this hotel if you have U of Miami hospital housing requirements, or pre cruise accommodation needs.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Review”
Reviews.Author: Travellingnurse1959
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not in the southbeach area it is within two blocks of the metromover which is a very affordable service to move you around the Miami area. We were there for 3 days and used the mover/subway all three days to see many tourist attractions. The hotel checkin was fast and the daily continental breakfast was plentiful. There is a small restauarant within the hotel with very affordable meals and a small store with the usual condiments. There are several restaurants within walking distance and security and gated underground parking at the hotel. We used the hotel shuttle to get to our cruise ship for a nominal fee of 5 dollars. The rooms are large and slept 5 easily with 2 double beds and a pullout couch. Each room had a small fridge, internet services and LED tv. The rooms were very quiet. There is a small pool and a great outdoor seating area that allowed us to enjoy the warm morning and evening air. It was a 15.00 dollar ride from the airport by cab.Overall a quaint and convienent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close distance to American Airlines Arena”
Reviews.Author: Rafiki63
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were only in Miami for two days. The hotel suited its purpose, in being located near American Airlines Arena. Yet if I had my time over, I would rather spend more money on a hotel on Miami beach and simply take a cab to the Arena. As it was we were too far away from attractions. Miami beach is so beautiful that I would want its view to wake up to, not buildings and traffic. Nonetheless, the hotel was always tidy, rooms were stunning, staff were friendly and the free breakfast offered a wide variety of food. However the buffet area was perhaps to small to accommodate so many people. The crowds to get breakfast got a tad overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Was not very pleased, but..........”
Reviews.Author: kiyayouragent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew down to Miami for a business cruise, but came in a day early and stayed at the SpringHill Suites near the Miami Cruise port. The nice thing about this hotel is that they provide free transportation to the hotel from the airport. However, when we got there and checked in, we realized that there was nothing nearby. We had not eaten dinner yet, so we were starving and was looking forward to checking in to our hotel room and getting a bite to eat and a cocktail. Well, there was nothing around and the neighborhood obviously was not safe, because when we asked the person at the front desk if there was a restaurant nearby that we could possibly walk to, she said that she would not advise us to walk. So with that, no dinner for us:( Secondly once we got up into our room, we realized that we were in a handicap room. I think that it is really nice to have rooms to accommodate our handicap citizens, however, we are not handicap and the bathroom floor had drains all over, because the same floors that you were suppose to shower on was the same floor that you walk on. I was not pleased and asked for a room switch and the lady at the front desk advised me that there were no more rooms available with a king bed and that we would have to take a room with two doubles. Well we did not want that, so we decided to stay until I saw a roach and then another one....YIKES! By this time, I was totally grossed out, hungry and disgusted. Despite the fact that we did not want to sleep in separate beds, I was not about to sleep in a room with roaches, so we opted to get the room switched to a room with two double beds. Well after all of that and having to lug our luggage to another floor, I definitely needed at least a cocktail, so I went down to the front desk and asked for a cab to take us to the nearest convenient store so that we could at least get some snacks and a cold beer. Well, even though the shuttle services were closed by then, the lady at the front desk was nice enough to ask the driver to drive us to the nearest convenient store which was a gas station right up the rode. SO, we were able to get water, snacks, cold beer and advil :) to get us through the night. That was very nice of her:) We finally got to sleep and woke up early to check out the continental breakfast which was horrible, but a nice thing to have there, I guess. My overall experience was not so good and I will not be returning to this hotel if I ever have to come back to Miami, but at least the staff was accommodating to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: trud5422
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January 2011 for 2 nights. My daughter was playing in a volleyball tournament at the Miami convention center and this hotel was recommended by the tournament. We loved this hotel and despite some of the reviews I read regarding the neighborhood, I felt very safe. The hotel has a parking garage that is locked and requires a key entry. The rooms are spacious and very clean. I love the fact that the bathroom is separated from the sink area so that 2 people can have privacy using these facilities at the same time. We ate in the hotel both nights for dinner and my daughters loved the food. I enjoyed drinks at the bar and found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that needs to be near the Health District/Convention Center/Port in MIami.

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: italvegan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days on our way to and from Mexico. Friendly staff. Not a walkable neighbourhood, but close to pretty much everything if have a car. Rooms are decent sized, clean, and washrooms as well (so rare these days). Not a bad price (though we were through friends/family discount).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: tcpr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was accommodating with every request., they were very helpful with sites to see, restaurants to visit, and knowledge of the area. The hotel was beautifully decorated and appeared to be brand new. I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know. In fact we are planning to return for Valentine's weekend.

Reviews.Title: “If you're on a budget and have a car, probably a decent option.”
Reviews.Author: toutlamonde
Reviews.Content: The SpringHill Suites in the Miami Arts/Health District had just opened when I stayed there. We got a promotion for stay 2 nights and get the 3rd night free so it ended up being a pretty good deal for $85/night. This was especially a good deal at the time because Art Basel was going on and hotels prices were substantially higher than normal. OK, now onto the hotel. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere right next to Miami-Jackson Memorial Medical Center so you'll probably want a car. It can be a confusing area since it seems like there are multiple versions of the same street i.e. 7th St, 7th Ave, 7th St Rd, 7th Rd. all within the same area! Since it was a new hotel, everything was really nice. Beds were comfy, nice big flat screen TV, couch, spacious rooms. They had two computers downstairs near the lobby where you could get free internet access. There was a decent breakfast buffet downstairs with your standard toast, bagels, waffle maker, fruits, cereal, eggs and ham. There was also a bar and a mini shop. We didn't pay for hotel parking and instead parked on a side street next to the hotel. There were 5-10 cars parked there every night and no one seemed to have problems, although the neighborhood is not that nice either. We had to drive at least 10-15 minutes to find a restaurant or to sightsee. South Beach is a solid 15-20 minute drive depending on traffic.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis, safe harbor is a sea of healthcare facilities.”
Reviews.Author: ka3twv
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, the best staff, very attentive and caring. We had a brother who was critically ill and the staff really helped us through a difficult time. The news should do a special on the wonderful service and hospitality provided to guests that have relatives in the nearby hospitals, they provided a cloistered environment where we felt safe and comfortable. They also provided shuttle service to the hospital excellent, drivers very caring and on time. The hotel accommodations are modern and clean. The breakfast offers a nice selection. I would highly reccommend this hotel to those visiting the Healthcare district.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in a haystack.”
Reviews.Author: baloondog
Reviews.Content: Nice place, hard to find. Garmin couldn't find the way out LOL. Parking is not free. Beautiful classy room. Breakfast is good. Mattress is great!! Internet...slower than dialup. Toilet door is a glass sliding, non airtight door and everything echos, so if you are in a wheelchair, it will be easy. If you need privacy, try somewhere else or send your loved one to the lobby. It will echo through the room if you get my drift. My wife and I stayed a week and will go back. We ended up loving it.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: BeckyAlbuquerque
Reviews.Content: We drove in late at night and were a little nervous about the neighborhood but once we were inside we found the hotel and rooms to be very new and clean. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Good selection of food at breakfast buffet. There is an attached parking garage that is gated and accessible with room key only so we felt safe during our 3 night stay. There is a small outdoor pool and an exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and affordable - did its purpose”
Reviews.Author: chirokelly
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for a family member who was in the hospital. It is convenient to the hospital. Safe parking garage inside. Hotel decor is very cute. Nothing lavish but contemporary and upbeat. Maid staff was not that great. Didnt replenish towels very well. Nice breakfast in the morning and nice bar area later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: SRQtravelqueen
Reviews.Content: Each year a group attends the tennis matches on Key Biscayne. We look for lodging in a convenient location and value. This year we chose SpringHill Suites since it was a newer property and friends and family rate was $79.00 per night. Upon arriving, we noticed college-age loitering around the outside smoking. We had to park on the side street to check in since the space under the portico was single lane and taken. Check-in was easy and also the parking garage was a breeze. Our suites were as expected except one suite had the nightlight on side of bed broken and hanging, clock was not illuminated as in other suite and the fans in both bath areas did not blow. For a new property, it shows a lot of wear. Stains on the fabric couches and bed decorator pillows. WHY DO HOTELS REPEATEDLY PUT THESE PILLOWS ON TOP OF CLEAN BED PILLOWCASES??? ICK!!! Plus the sliding, frosted glass doors on bath areas do not provide much privacy. Upon returning the first night, the room had been cleaned but the coffee area was neglected. Old cup was not replaced nor the cream/sugar packets. Complimentary breakfast is better than most. We enjoyed the waffle maker and fresh fruit selection. There are two computers near the elevators for guests to use. The location, near Jackson Memorial Hospital, is a little questionable. But, the garage is gated and secured. Absolutely no view, except if looking at chickens in a backyard and watching a homeless person create and dismantle his home each night is desirable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great service, great value, wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: ultrafuntime
Reviews.Content: It was spring break weekend in Miami and we called in the morning to try and find a hotel for that night. We knew it would be difficult and not to mention expensive. So we called around and stumbled upon this place that had a few rooms left but were going to be sold out. We were kind of apprehensive about the place as it had mixed reviews. But when we got there we were very pleased to find that it was immaculate. We paid $169.00 plus tax for a room with 2 Queen beds, a sofa with a pullout bed, a giant plasma screen HDTV, a nice shower with vanity mirror and a separate room with a toilet and sink, plus a microwave, fridge, iHome, Wired/Wireless internet access, a laundry room, 24 hour access to the gym, and parking which was like $13. This was all on the day of!! The service here is spectacular, the front desk is always there to answer the phone and do whatever you need and with a positive polite attitude no matter how busy they are. They have a general store in the lobby to buy food and drinks and pretty much whatever you would need on your travels. And don't let me forget about the Continental Breakfast! I've worked at a few hotels and have stayed in many but this breakfast was one of the best ive seen. Everything is fresh and they dont just have bagels and danishes, they have a waffle maker and omelletes, and fresh juices and yogurts too as well as fresh fruit. The stylings of the building are also aestetically pleasing, all modern finishings so it looks new and clean. We had a freind staying at the JW Marriot in a Presidential Suite and we were shocked when we walked into his room to find that our room was bigger and nicer than his!! The only negative thing about this place is the location. It is kind of in an impoverished location in Miami so you might be hesistant to walk in the wrong direction at night but the hotel itself doesnt look scary or rundown at all it is beautiful and there is a gated 5 level parking garage so you feel very safe staying here. We went to a music festival in South Beach and the problem is that none of the taxi drivers would take us back to our hotel because they didnt want to get stuck in traffic or beacause they didnt know where it was. This was very frustrating but I think that if our music event of over 50,000 people wasnt flooding the streets this wouldnt be much of a problem. We would love to stay here again and probably will next year. Kudos to the Springhill Suites Marriot!

Reviews.Title: “Cruise goer's stop, NOT a business hotel, understaffed restaurant”
Reviews.Author: fay711
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting a local hospital and chose to stay for the first time at this hotel because of the proximity. I am a platium member at Marriott and have been increasingly unhappy with the facilities. There are no suites at this hotel, all the rooms are the same. This hotel has free shuttle service to the local cruise port and was full of the sterotypical cruise goer. It was extrememly loud. Also the first room I checked into was not fully clean. The carpet hadn't been vaccumed and there were bits of plastic and paper all over the floor, so they moved us to another room. The restaurant had 4 people total working, including the kitchen. I placed an order and an hour later it finally came out. Multiple other tables received their food before me that had ordered afterwards. I heard plenty of aplogies, which didn't lessen my irritation. Long story short, this is not a business friendly hotel. Expect subpar service.

HotelInfo.Name: SpringHill Suites by Marriott Miami Airport East/Medical Center
HotelInfo.Address: 1311 NW 10th Avenue, Miami, FL 33136
